string.text:
The Nostromo touches down on the planetoid and its heavy engines whirr down to silence.
You sit in the airlock chamber, poised for action.
A rattle of dust and debris whips across the airlock door infront of you.
What wonders could await at the beacon?
The airlock chamber is a sterile place. Around you is your spacesuit and the door to the outside. A red light pulses gently and the hum of the ships systems tickles your ears.

The airlock doors whirr into life and thud open in the new pressure of the planetoid's environment.
You step out.
The airlock hasn't been primed. The pressure difference will tear the ship apart, and kill you in the process.

You are already wearing your spacesuit.
Quit stalling!
You pick up your spacesuit's helmet and click it into place. The world becomes muffled and you can feel your heart beating to the pulse of the red light above the airlock doors.
You aren't wearing your spacesuit. The change in pressure will cause servere damage to your vital organs.
Through your suit you feel a change in pressure as the pulse of the red light increases. There is a burst of white smoke and the light calms again.

You step outside the airlock.
Wind whistles across your visor, and the sound of flying rubble fills your ears through the muffled suit.
Just in front of you is the derelict, and behind you is the airlock you just left.
You feel alone with your thoughts in this harsh place.

Wind whips debris across the land infront of you, which is pulled in twisted shapes and formations from the harsh conditions. Just infront of you is the derelict ship, you can see what looks like an entrance to it.

Infront of you is a monolithic structure like nothing you have ever seen. Ribbed organic-like beams run down its sides, and it as a whole arcs up to the sky and into the fog above.
There is what looks like an opening just infront of where you stand, clear of all debris.
You want to go inside.

You walk towards the derelict ship, avoiding the wind warped rocks that cover your path.
As you approach it, you understand its scale. It's an ungodly size - far larger than anything a human could create.

You walk back inside to the safety of the airlock, not ready to face the harsh conditions outside the ship.
You've got to leave at some point!

The ship engulfs the landscape.
Infront of you seems to be a now clear enterance point, and behind you, your ship.

Scared by the giantic creation infront, you dart back to the ship as quick as your suit will allow you to run.
This isn't how explorers should behave!

You approach the derelict ship, the wind whistles on the outside of your suit still.
Infront of you is a monolithic structure like nothing you have ever seen. Ribbed organic-like beams run down its sides, and it as a whole arcs up to the sky and into the fog above.
You think you can see an opening up ahead, but debris blocks your path to it. Your explosives may come in handy to clear your route.
Infront of you is what looks like an enterance to the derelict ship, but it is blocked by debris. In your backpack are some explosives that may come in handy to clear your path.

You place your explosives on the rubble and step back.
The detonator clicks in your hand and a dust cloud fills your vision. As it clears, you can see your clear path ahead.

You approach the derelict's enterance.
Is is dark and wet.
The hairs on your skin stand on end as you near.
